speaker: DET. BARBALA
line: What ho.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: What ho.

speaker: DET. BARBALA
line: Hey, Lazard. Now why do the night guys get a piece like you when we're stuck with old eel breath?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: It's fate, Detective, conspiring to keep us apart. All right, I'm outta here. See ya. Tomorrow.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: You all right? You lost?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Anyway, I got her in the holding room. She's not talking, she won't say a word... at least not to me.

speaker: DET. BARBALA
line: And you're asking me because you know how good I am with kids, right?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Yeah, a regular Mr. Greenjeans.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Hi. This is Detective Barbala. He's gonna help you find your parents.

speaker: DET. BARBALA
line: Hi ya sweetheart. What's your name?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Michelle.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Everything's gonna be all right. OK? Don't be scared now.

speaker: DET. BARBALA
line: Michelle what? Well, you said your first name was Michelle, now what's your last name?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Bishop.

speaker: DET. BARBALA
line: Bishop. Michelle Bishop. And where do you live, Michelle? Here in Buffalo?

speaker: VARIOUS IN PRECINCT HOUSE
line: What was that? Did you hear that?

speaker: MAN FROM STREET BELOW
line: Somebody call an ambulance!

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you hear about us?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: My brother. My, uh, my brother's a cop. Baltimore. He told me about your work on the Tooms case, said you gotta good feel for things out of the ordinary. Look, the truth is Barbala never won any popularity contests here at the one-four, but he's, he's still a cop, you know. I guess that's why I can't just let this rest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said there was one witness, a little girl. What did she say happened?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: She said there was another man in the room.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it stands to reason that somebody...

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: I was right outside. I'm telling you, there was nobody else there except for Barbala and the kid.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you didn't get a description of who the kid saw?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: I'm telling you, there was no one else. Listen. The department is treating this as a suicide, but I gotta tell you. I knew this guy. There's no way he did himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was he depressed or under psychiatric care of any kind?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: No. Only time he ever looked at himself was in the mirror. And he always liked what he saw.

speaker: MULDER
line: Plus jumpers tend to open the window before they jump. Where's the kid now?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: She was released about an hour ago. Her mother came to pick her up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't really think the girl had anything to do with it, do you?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: I don't know what to believe any more. You know, eight years I've been on this force, I've seen a lot of strange things. But I'm telling you... this kid... something's just not right about her.

speaker: LINHART
line: Did he have long hair or short hair?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Short.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like that? Was his hair dark like mine or lighter like yours?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Like mine.

speaker: LINHART
line: What about a beard or a moustache?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Moustache.

speaker: LINHART
line: Like this? Or this?

speaker: LINHART
line: Whoa! What happened? Weird. I didn't even hit a key. Must be a glitch in the new software.

speaker: MULDER
line: Michelle? Was his mustache like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any idea how your daughter might have gotten there? Buffalo's half an hour away by train and the station is a five minute car ride.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: When I came home, Mrs. Dougherty was locked in the wine cellar. I called the police immediately.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Mrs. Dougherty is?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: Michelle's nanny. The latest, that is. She's already gone through four this year, and it's only April.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What seems to be the problem?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: Michelle is the problem.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you mean?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: As hard as it is for a mother to admit... Michelle is a disturbed child. Oh, I know this sounds terrible to say, but the truth is that sometimes she frightens me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Frightens you how?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: She's not like other girls, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tell me.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: She just isn't. She doesn't have any friends. She hardly ever smiles. It breaks my heart that I can't comfort her. She says she sees things that I can't see. She hears people yelling in her head.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: Last summer we had to cover our pool. Jim was trying to teach her how to swim, but every time that Michelle would get close to the water, she would just start to scream - scream like you've never heard in all your life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your husband? Where is he now?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: We're divorced.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Bishop?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: Um-hmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the man Michelle says she saw at the police station. Do you recognize him?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: She also mentioned a friend... someone named Sheila. Do you know who that is?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: That would be Dr. Braun. She's the developmental psychologist over at Brylin Hospital. Michelle sees her twice a week.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at that? Looks like a hawk or a falcon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's beautiful.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: It's called origami.

speaker: MULDER
line: Japanese paper folding. Where'd she learn how to do that?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: I have no idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: So Harry, you'll put that face into the system?

speaker: LINHART
line: As we speak.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you give Scully a ride back into the city?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a minute. We have an autopsy at 7.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's your department. I'm gonna go over to Brylin Hospital, see if I can have a little chat with Michelle's shrink.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, oh, and check for burns or lesions on Barbala's body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Psychokinesis is usually associated with an electrical charge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying Michelle possesses the ability to psychically project her own will?

speaker: MULDER
line: How else could a 60-pound kid throw a 200-pound detective out the window?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: Nope. I don't recognize him. I have no idea who this man is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could Michelle have fabricated him?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: Quite possibly. As with many dissociative disorders, the intensity of the patient's emotions is often too much for one personality to process. So in defense, part of the personality splits itself off.

speaker: MULDER
line: As in schizophrenia?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: I'm afraid Michelle's diagnosis is not quite that simple. You see, my primary challenge has been to discover the source of her extreme rage. In most cases, it's a traumatic event in the patient's past.

speaker: MULDER
line: And in Michelle's case?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: Occasionally, I would leave Michelle alone for part of our session - with this doll. Each time a new doll, anatomically intact. And each time, she dismembers and disfigures it in exactly the same way. First I thought she was being abused, but after a number of sessions with her parents, I became convinced that there was something else behind Michelle's anxiety. Something much deeper, much more elusive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any theories?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: Frankly, no. I'm at a loss.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you tried deep regression hypnosis?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: I've found hypnosis an unreliable approach at best.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK. Well, in the meantime, how have you been treating Michelle?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: Well, the thorazine has been quite effective in regulating her more bizarre behavior.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure. Have you observed any unexplained phenomena in Michelle's presence?

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: Unexplained phenomena?

speaker: MULDER
line: Inordinate physical strength, psychic ability, telekinesis...

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: You're joking, of course.

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: I have a patient waiting, Agent Mulder. If you'll excuse me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Note postmortem examination is being conducted 11 hours and 45 minutes after subject was pronounced. Note raised lesion approximately 7 centimeters below sternum. Deep necrosis inconsistent with cause of death as pronounced by Dr. Gilder, and suggests localized electrocution... but a further tissue analysis will be necessary.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Excuse me. Could I talk to you for a second?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just started the autopsy.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Yeah. Um, I don't think he's going anywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Will you, uh, take a couple for scale, please. Thank you. I'll be right back.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: So what do you think?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like a match.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Yeah. Name's Charlie Morris. Officer Charlie Morris. Used to work narcotics out at the two-seven.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know him?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: No. Before my time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he now? Has he been transferred?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: You could say that. Agent Scully, this guy's been dead for nine years. Which means that little girl saw... a ghost.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was killed in Chinatown - gangland style, allegedly by the Triads, although no arrests were ever made. Now Mulder, if you're gonna tell me that you think Michelle Bishop saw a poltergeist...

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, you're the one that found a lesion on Barbala's body. You said it could have been caused by an intense concentration of electrothermal energy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Could have been" being the operative phrase. Now, I'm not going to know for sure until the lab results are in, and even then...

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is it still so hard for you to believe, even when all the evidence suggests extraordinary phenomena?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because sometimes...

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... looking for extreme possibilities makes you blind to the probable explanation right in front of you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the face that Michelle Bishop saw. She walked right by here and she saw the face of Charlie Morris... which means that there weren't any ghosts flying around the precinct.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have the police report describing Morris' death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I have what's been declassified. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Does it describe how he was murdered?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I told you. It was a signature hit.

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me the grisly details.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His arm was severed just below the shoulder, presumably by a chainsaw, and his right eye was gouged out.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is what Michelle did to a dozen dolls in her shrink's office. Hell of a coincidence, wouldn't you say? Now before we discount anything, I think we should find out more about Charlie Morris. I got the address of his partner on the force. Hopefully, he can tell us something.

speaker: MULDER
line: Detective Fiore? We're with the FBI. Can we talk to you for a minute? Do you know this man?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: You mind if we do this out here? Uh, I don't want to wake my wife.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, this won't take long.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Yeah, sure I know him. That's, uh, Charlie. Charlie Morris.

speaker: MULDER
line: You two were partners?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Yeah, we rode together his first nine months out of the academy.

speaker: MULDER
line: What can you tell us about the circumstances surrounding his death?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: That matter is still under investigation and so I can't comment on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Detective, we're under the direct authority of Captain Gershom at the 14th precinct.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: 14th precinct? I never worked out of the one-four. What's all this about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we believe that the death of Detective Rudy Barbala yesterday can be linked to the death of Officer Morris nine years ago.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Linked how? I thought this Barbala flipped his wig and jumped out of a window.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you know the detective?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: By reputation. Look, what's all this got to do with Charlie?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's what we need your help with. The police report said that Officer Morris was killed off-duty.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: That's right. Best we can figure, it was some kind of payback.

speaker: MULDER
line: For what?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Well, around that time, the organized crime division was doing a major sweep in Chinatown.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Triads.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Yeah. Some very heavy busts went down against the Woo Shing Woo. A lot of smack never made it to the street. You can bet there were some pretty pissed off people playing Mah-Jongg that week.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you think that Charlie Morris was killed as a warning to back off?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I think they picked a cop - any cop - and they whacked him.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Who is it, Tony?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Oh, it's nothing to worry about, honey. Just some people from the FBI asking about a case I'm working.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, would you mind...

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Hey, it's the weekend. You guys mind? You can get me at the squad, first thing Monday morning, OK?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sure.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Good luck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it me or did we just get the brush-off?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you notice her hands?

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He said she was sleeping, but her hands were dusted with baking flour.

speaker: FELDER
line: Not a big deal, all right? Don't jerk yourself around Tony. You're acting like a little bug.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: They were FBI.

speaker: FELDER
line: So what?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: They start sniffing around too much, they're gonna turn something up.

speaker: FELDER
line: Relax. They're just people like us, going through the motions.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Oh, yeah? Then how are they connecting Charlie to Barbala?

speaker: FELDER
line: And what do they know? Huh? Nothing.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Come on. We're going to Citibank right now.

speaker: FELDER
line: For what?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: The safety box.

speaker: FELDER
line: And what should we do, Tony? Huh? Make a donation to the Little Sisters for the Poor?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Dump it somewhere.

speaker: FELDER
line: Tony. There's only two of us left now. That's over a million each.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Take it all, I don't care! Do your dream on the beach in Costa Rica or wherever the hell it is you want to do it.

speaker: FELDER
line: You think I like this? Selling disability insurance to morons? "Well sir, uh, excuse me, but what if you should break your neck on the shore on lose your leg in a car crash?" You listen to me, Tony. We agreed to wait ten years, and that is exactly what we're gonna do.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I listened to you once before and look what happened.

speaker: FELDER
line: Nobody - not me, not Barbala - wanted to see Charlie wind up like that. We were just trying to scare a little sense into him. It was an accident. End of story. And you better pull yourself together, Tony.

speaker: OLD WOMAN
line: Excuse me, sir.

speaker: FELDER
line: Hey, what? Hey! Hey, open the door! Hey!

speaker: FELDER
line: Hey, open the door! Hey! Open the door! Hey! Open the door! Open the door! Hey! Open the door!

speaker: FELDER
line: Hey! Hey! Open the door! For God's sake! Help me!

speaker: MULDER
line: A patrol unit picked her up a few blocks away from the bus stop.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: What's going on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We don't know. All we know is that your daughter has witnessed two deaths in the past two days.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: She's only eight years old. She couldn't have possibly done anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Bishop, no one is accusing Michelle of anything.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: She's just a little girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there anything that you haven't told us? Is there anything at all that you can think of that might shed some light on what happened tonight?

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, this police station has a designated room at the Sheraton. An officer will take you and Michelle over there.

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: Why is this happening to us. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, excuse me.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Listen to this. You know that guy that bought it tonight - Leon Felder? Before he started peddling life insurance, he was a cop out of the one-four. Guess who his partner used to be? Rudy Barbala.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Four cops.

speaker: MULDER
line: Three of whom are now dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Their only connection being a drug bust in Chinatown almost nine years ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: And a little girl from Orchard Park.

speaker: MULDER
line: Morris, Fiore, Barbala and Felder. What's wrong with this picture?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, for one thing Fiore said he only knew Barbala by reputation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right. Why would he say that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a page gone from Morris' homicide file. Wonder where it could be?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there a log sheet?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Should be. Yeah. Tony Fiore - checked out this afternoon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Fiore, we're sorry for the early hour, but is your husband home?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: No, he's not. He never came home last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: May we come in?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. Look familiar?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: He said he was working a double shift, but when I called the precinct, he wasn't scheduled. It's just not like him not to call.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does your husband have any family or close friends in the area that he might go to if he were in trouble?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: I've been on the phone all night. Is he in any trouble?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Fiore, did your husband ever mention a detective by the name of Rudy Barbala or an ex-police officer named Leon Felder?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: I don't think so.

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone you might have had dinner with once, a friend of Tony's from work? A name you can't remember, anything?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: We don't normally socialize with other cops.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Fiore, I couldn't help noticing your origami collection. Did you do all these yourself?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Oh, no, not me. No, that was Charlie's hobby.

speaker: MULDER
line: Charlie?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: My first husband. He was born in Japan, his father was stationed there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not Charlie Morris, Tony's ex-partner?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Yeah. I was waiting for him to come home too, nine years ago. Just like this. He was working on a whole set, you know, from the painting. The only animal he never got to was the giraffe - see, right there behind the zebra.

speaker: MULDER
line: Michelle is eight years old, that means that she was conceived at roughly the same time that Officer Morris was killed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do me a favor, Mulder. Let me say it. Reincarnation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Metempsychosis, transmigration, reimbodiment, call it what you will.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All based on the coincidence that Michelle Bishop and Officer Morris both practice the obscure art of paper folding?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what about the composite drawing and the dolls and the fact that Michelle was witness to two deaths that can be tied to Charlie Morris?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what, you think he's back like Peter Proud to avenge his murder?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not so far-fetched, Scully. Reincarnation is a basic tenet of many major religions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That still doesn't explain how an eight-year-old girl can kill two grown men.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, individuals with strong past-life memories often exhibit enhanced psychic abilities - ESP, telekinesis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So where does that leave us?

speaker: MULDER
line: One short step away from proving the pre-existence of the human soul.

speaker: DR. SPITZ
line: On a count of five, tell me where you are now... one... two... three... four... five. Do you know where you are?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Yes.

speaker: DR. SPITZ
line: Where? Tell me where you are.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: At home.

speaker: DR. SPITZ
line: What time of day is it?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Night time.

speaker: DR. SPITZ
line: And how old are you?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Twenty-four. No! We can't! We can't do this! It's wrong!

speaker: DR. SPITZ
line: What's wrong? What can't you do? It's all right, you can trust me.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: No! I can't! I can't! I can't! I can't! I can't!

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: This is dangerous and irresponsible!

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Spitz has conducted hundreds of these sessions and...

speaker: DR. BRAUN
line: If you allow this to continue, you could push Michelle deeper into withdrawal, maybe permanently.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it any more dangerous than pumping her full of thorazine?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: They're killing me! They're killing me!

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: That's enough!

speaker: MICHELLE
line: No! No! No!

speaker: MRS. BISHOP
line: It's OK. It's over. It's over. It's over.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They just left.

speaker: MULDER
line: We almost had it, Scully. We were right there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know.

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll have to try it again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Bishop won't go for that, not in this lifetime anyway.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we have to change her mind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How? And to what end? I mean, what exactly do you hope to discover by all this?

speaker: MULDER
line: The truth. What really happened to Charlie Morris nine years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We'll find the truth when we find Fiore.

speaker: MULDER
line: If we find Fiore. And if he's still alive. Scully, you saw what happened in there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I saw was some traumatized little girl who for no apparent reason has some connection to Charlie Morris.

speaker: MULDER
line: All evidence suggests that Michelle Bishop IS Charlie Morris.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Short of her growing a moustache, how much more apparent does it have to become for you to accept it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK. Let's just say that, by some small miracle, you manage to convince Michelle's mother, and the next hypno-regression provides you with everything you could possible hope for. No grand jury is gonna listen to that kind of testimony. We still will not have an actionable case.

speaker: MULDER
line: The inconclusive results of Michelle's past life regression do not shake my basic belief in hypnosis as a tool for psychological healing. Whether or not it offers us definitive proof of previous lifetimes is another matter. However, in this particular case, all other explanations seem to be even more wanting.

speaker: ON VIDEO
line: And how old are you? Twenty-four. No, we can't! We can't do this! It's wrong! What's wrong? What can't you do?

speaker: ON VIDEO
line: And how old are you? Twenty-four. No we can't!

speaker: ON VIDEO
line: Twenty-four.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: No, no, I, I, I want to be here. In case he shows up. Thanks again. I'll, uh, I'll call you the minute I hear anything. OK, yeah, OK, bye-bye.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Tony! Tony? Tony?

speaker: LINHART
line: I checked the windup profiles. They're up to speed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which means?

speaker: LINHART
line: Whatever this image is, was recorded in the room with that girl.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is that possible?

speaker: MULDER
line: There was a documented case in the early seventies of a man from Porlock, Ohio, who could influence undeveloped film. He could create shapes on the negative from his mind.

speaker: LINHART
line: I don't know how much of this noise I can clean up. It depends on the strength of the latent image.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: I tracked him down. He's retired in Palm Beach. You were right, Agent Scully. He backed up all his records on disk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Pathologists are paranoid by nature.

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Well, he faxed me the missing page from the autopsy report.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Great. Apparently, Charlie Morris did not die as a result of his wounds. Says here there's a frothing of fluid in the respiratory tract. That indicates death by drowning.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you're saying he was drowned first and then mutilated to make it look like a signature execution?

speaker: DET. LAZARD
line: Dr. Yamaguchi said on the phone that there were no signs of submersion such as goose skin or wrinkled flesh except for around the face and head.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um-hmm. That's right. Suggesting that he was killed in either a bathtub or a toilet. Except...

speaker: MULDER
line: Except for what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The marked bradycardia. That indicates a raised plasma sodium level. He was killed in sea water.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Anita! Anita!

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Tony! Tony! What's going on? Where've you been? I know something's going on.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I need you to listen to me right now. I need you to go upstairs and pack a bag.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Why? What kind of trouble are you in?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I think someone's trying to kill me.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Who?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I don't know.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Why would anybody want to kill you? Tell me what's going on.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Will you please just do what I'm asking you? Please, I'm your husband and I love you and I need you to trust me on this, OK?

speaker: LINHART
line: Almost there. What I've done is to map the frequencies of the interference. Coefficients for sine on this monitor, cosine on that one. Now using an algorithm program, I can remove the frequencies, like this. Presto! What the hell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: You said salt water, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. So?

speaker: MULDER
line: So Charlie Morris was drowned in his own tropical fish tank, and that's the last thing he saw before he died. We better hope Michelle Bishop is at home, tucked in bed.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Tony? Tony, somebody, somebody left this on our doorstep tonight. Do you know who? Answer me, Tony!

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Right, you stay here and keep the door closed.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Tony, are you all right? Tony, answer me!

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Tony! Tony, please! Who's there? What's happening?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: They said they were just gonna talk to you. Talk some sense into you. What was I supposed to do, huh? All you had to do was take the money, man! Why didn't you just take the money?

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: What's going on, Tony? Let me out!

speaker: MULDER
line: Go check out upstairs.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Please open the door! I'm scared! Tony!

speaker: MULDER
line: Michelle! This won't make right what happened.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Please, I can't get out! Who's there? I can't get out!

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Tony! Tony! Tony...

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I'm sorry! I knew what they did to Charlie. I was a part of it and I never said anything. I couldn't.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: No.

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: I just wanted to take care of you. Who else would have taken care of you?

speaker: DET. FIORE
line: Oh, God. No. No more.

speaker: MRS. FIORE
line: Please, please don't hurt him any more.

speaker: MULDER
line: Closing entry, file number X-40271. Detective Anthony Fiore pleaded guilty yesterday in federal court to charges of first-degree murder after the fact, grand larceny and obstruction of justice. The deaths of Detective Rudy Barbala and former police officer Leon Felder are being ruled as accidental, although their complicity in the murder of Officer Charlie Morris has been definitively established. No charges were brought against Michelle Bishop, who today took her first swimming lesson. She claims no memory of the preceding events and both her mother and Dr. Braun have denied my request for a second past-life regression. End of field journal, April 19, 1994.
